queue.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a line of people waiting to enter a building, buy something etc, or a line of vehicles waiting to move
queue.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: You’ll have to join the queue.
We stood in a queue for half an hour.
At last we got to the front of the queue.
a queue of people waiting for the bus
There was a long queue to get into the cinema.
queue.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: all the people who are waiting to have or get something
queue.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: You’ll have to join the housing queue.
It is possible to jump the queue  (=get something before people who have been waiting longer) if you are prepared to pay for your treatment.
the queue for kidney transplant operations
queue.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: a list of jobs that a computer has to do in a particular order
queue.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a number of telephone calls to a particular number that are waiting to be answered
queue.translation[0].note_box[0].section: stand/wait in a queue
She stood in the queue at the checkout.
be in a queue
I've been in this queue for fifteen minutes.
form a queue
Other passengers for the train were forming a queue.
join a queue
He went back inside to join the queue for the toilets.
take your place in a queue
I walked to the bus stop and took my place in the queue.
jump the queue
An argument developed when she tried to jump the queue.
a queue forms
A queue had formed outside the shop.
a queue stretches somewhere
The queue stretched the full length of the building.
long/big
Already a long queue had formed outside the concert hall
There was a big queue.
There was a small queue of people waiting to see the doctor.
an orderly queue
She told the children to form an orderly queue.
the front/head of the queue
He pushed his way to the front of the queue.
the back/end of the queue
Get to the back of the queue!
be first in a queue
I wanted to be first in the queue when the doors opened.
queue.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to form or join a line of people or vehicles waiting to do something or go somewhere
queue.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Some of the people queuing for tickets had been there since dawn.
We had to queue up for ages to get served.
queue.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: if people are queuing up to do something, they all want to do it very much
queue.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The school is one of the best, and parents are queuing up to send their children there.
Actresses are queuing up for the part.
queue.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: a line of people waiting to enter a building, buy something etc
queue.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: There may be long queues outside stores at sale times.
queue.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: a list of jobs that a computer has to do in a particular order
queue.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: the number of jobs in the batch queue
queue.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to form or join a line of people or vehicles waiting to do something or go somewhere
queue.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Customers queued for hours to buy the new toy.
I queued up at the travel centre to pick up my tickets.
queue.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: if a computer queues a job, it puts it in a list of jobs that are to be done in a particular order
queue.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: Input or output requests to a file are queued by the operating system.
